instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK: What is PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK? This is a typo of PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK When you see PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK, assume they meant to type PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK.

threads.title: 2915 No Boot No <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board starts but no USB activity.

<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>= 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWOK</SIGNAL>=3.4V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> =0V diode to ground there is .4V

Assuming ths board also has GPU issue... 
but GPU VCORE = 1.15V and .05V diode to ground OR 4ohms (I assume low voltage drop is normal being the voltage looks right?)

threads.title: 2915 No Boot No <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is required, to start communication between board chips.
What about <SIGNAL>CPU_PWRGD</SIGNAL> abd <SIGNAL>PM_MEM_PWRGD_R</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 2915 No Boot No <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Dah... just double checked <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and its there. Still no USB activity on either port, no chime, no blips of life detected with external display.
I'm going to try BIOS. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.

threads.title: 2915 No Boot No <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Be sure to get known good working BIOS.
Also check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.

Try disabling GPU in BIOS, to discard it.
More easy to flash GMUX.

threads.title: 2915 No Boot No <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Assuming I would end up disabling the GPU anyway, I just went ahead and removed it and sure enough... USB data activity, so looks like I'll be able to get this board back in action. Thanks!!!
